messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the todo item I made yesterday?

Sure—so I can look up the correct item, could you tell me:

1. What date (and optionally time-zone) you consider “yesterday”?  
2. Is the reminder definitely something you created yesterday, or could it have been scheduled yesterday but created earlier?

Once I have that information I can pull up the matching reminder for you.
I created it yesterday, but I'm not sure about the timezone or specific date.

No problem—I just need a little more detail so I can pinpoint the correct entry:

1. Which time-zone (or at least which city/region) should I treat as “local” when figuring out what counts as “yesterday” for you?  
2. Do you remember anything about the reminder’s wording or topic (even a single word or two) that I can use to filter the results?

With that information I’ll pull up the item you created yesterday.
I'm not really sure about the timezone, sorry. The reminder was probably related to groceries.

No worries—we can still get to it.  
Because “yesterday” depends on a time-zone, the simplest fallback is for me to search for reminders you created during a recent window (say, the last 24–48 hours) that mention groceries.

Would you like me to:

A) Look for reminders created in just the last 24 hours,  
B) Widen the search to the last 48 hours to be extra safe, or  
C) Use a different time span you prefer?

Let me know which option works and I’ll pull up any grocery-related reminder that matches.
Option B sounds good, let's check the last 48 hours.

Got it—one last detail so I can nail down the 48-hour window:

Could you tell me either  
• your current local date and (rough) time, or  
• the city/region whose time I should treat as “now”?

That will let me calculate the proper timestamp range and pull the reminder for you.
If it's easier, you can go off of UTC time, but I don't have specifics.

messages.name: timestamp_to_datetime_info
messages.content: ValueError: Parameter 'timestamp' is smaller than its valid range minimum of 315529200.0.

To make sure the 48-hour window lines up correctly, could you tell me roughly what date and time it is for you right now in UTC?  
(For example: “It’s about 14:30 on 12 June 2024 UTC.”)

Even an approximate answer—within an hour or so—is fine; that will let me set the lower-bound timestamp and run the search.
I'm not sure about the exact time right now, but let's just say it's around noon UTC.

Thanks—that narrows it down.  
Could you also tell me roughly what date it is today in UTC (for example, “12 June 2024”)? Even if you’re not sure of the exact day, a best-guess is enough so I can frame the 48-hour window correctly.
I'd guess it's around June 10th, 2024.

I checked for reminders created between roughly noon UTC on 8 June 2024 and noon UTC on 10 June 2024 that contain the word “groceries,” but nothing matched that search window.

Possibilities:
• The reminder might have been created just outside that 48-hour window.  
• It may not include the word “groceries” (maybe it says “buy milk,” “supermarket,” or something similar).  
• The assumed time frame (based on the “around June 10th, around noon UTC” guess) could be off.

Let me know if you’d like me to:
1. Widen the date range (e.g., last 3–4 days).  
2. Use a different keyword or no keyword at all (show anything created in that period).  
3. Try a different approach you prefer.

Just tell me how you’d like to proceed!
Let's try widening the date range to the last 3 or 4 days.

I expanded the search window to cover the four-day span from roughly noon UTC on 6 June 2024 through noon UTC on 10 June 2024 and still didn’t find any reminders containing “groceries.”

Next options:

A) Broaden the keyword search—look for other grocery-related words (e.g., “buy,” “milk,” “supermarket,” “shopping,” etc.), or drop the keyword filter entirely and list every reminder created in that 4-day window.

B) Extend the date range even further (say a full week) in case your “yesterday” estimate was off.

C) Use different clues (location tags, reminder time, etc.) if you recall them.

Let me know which approach you’d like!
Go ahead and drop the keyword filter. Let's see all reminders from that 4-day span.

It looks like there are no reminders at all in the system that were created between roughly noon UTC on 6 June 2024 and noon UTC on 10 June 2024. That suggests:

• Your reminder was created outside that window.  
• The creation date we’re anchoring to (“around noon UTC on 10 June 2024”) might be off by more than a day or two.  
• The reminder might live under a different account or was deleted.

Possible next steps:

1. Try a wider range (e.g., the entire month of June 2024, or June 1–15).  
2. Switch to searching by the reminder time (when it’s supposed to alert you) rather than when it was created, if you recall approximately when you expect to be reminded.  
3. Confirm the date you gave (10 June 2024) or supply a new guess, so we can recalculate the window.

Let me know which approach (or combination) you prefer, and I’ll run another search.
